results.title: Metal makers
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the mining and processing of copper, silver, lead and zinc at Mt. Isa, one of the world’s largest underground mines. Covers such aspects as the operation of the mine, mining techniques, mineral extractions and smelting, refining and distribution of the processed metal. Uses of the various metals are illustrated. Quality and pollution controls are also explained. The importance of Mt. Isa as a large inland city is also stressed.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.

results.title: Radio day
results.brief_description: A promotional exercise that shows a day in the life of radio station 3XY in Melbourne. Although most of the activities carried out in a commercial radio station are depicted, there is no attempt to explain why and as such this production does little to demystify the process. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Peep-peep-peep
results.brief_description: Puppet animated film about the Wombles who live under Wimbledon Common in London. In this episode the Wombles discover a crude version of the telephone by using tins and string. Based on the children’s book series The Wombles by Elizabeth Beresford. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Woolloomooloo
results.brief_description: A social and historical documentary on the redevelopment of one of Sydney’s oldest harbourside areas, from the initial plans of 1969 to the completion of the Housing Commission’s renovation project in late 1977. Details the roles of local, State and Federal governments, the State Planning Authority, The National Trust, the developers, the Builders’ Labourers Federation led by Jack Mundey, and the residents groups.

results.title: Conrad Martens
results.creator_credit: Clytie Jessop and National Trust of Australia
results.brief_description: Concerns the life and work of early Colonial artist Conrad Martens whose paintings and sketches are a valuable historical record of Australia. Deals with Marten’s work in England, his voyage on “The Beagle” and his friendship with Charles Darwin, and his output in Sydney.

results.title: Shadow panic
results.brief_description: I am the dreamer, the redhead. I search for hidden treasure: which fragment would yield gold, which memory would haunt forever? Three women, strangers to each other, yet their lives seem inexplicably linked. “Shadow Panic” is a short experimental film about internal and external states of emergency, about personal and collective shadows, about resistance and spirit.

results.title: Banduk
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Penelope Spence and National Nine Network
results.brief_description: Banduk, a young Aboriginal girl, and her friends discover that the “friendly” proprietors of an ice-cream van are smuggling native animals, including the sacred red-collared parakeet, out of Australia. This delightful story was filmed on location in Arnhem Land.
